Comment-EnableStreamMetaData: [This Feature is a PRO Feature and is strongly meant for direct MetaData extraction and to be used in connection with Stream Monitoring Program, like my - Check-And-Restart- Project.]
Comment-StoreChunkSizeInKB: [The parts size in which the Source-Stream is cached in the Application, needs to be 64KB or a multiple of it (32KB/64KB/128KB/256KB). Use 32KB for 128kbps and 192kbps ]
Comment-NumOfPartsToBeStoredIntoDBbel: [If the Count of num of parts of the Stream is greater than this value, the oldest one will be deleted]
Comment-CancellationTokeReadTimeout: [After how many seconds to Cancel the source Stream read to part]
Comment-CancellationTokenTimeoutWrite: [After how many seconds to cancel the part write to MemoryStream in partCreation]
Comment-CancellationCombinedTokenReqA: [After how many seconds to cancel the part write to User-Client-Apps]
Comment-waitBeforePlayerFirstCallDela: [How many seconds to wait after part-creation has been started and before the init (Warm-up-phase) should start]
Comment-ChannelGroupMaxSizePerQueue: When the value set is exceeded, an additional Queue will be added.
Comment-Signaling: SignalingSegments: 1 to 6 - 1 means off; For MP3 for 64KB chunk (320kbps): 2 / 600 -- For 32KB chunk (128KB): 2 / 600 or For 32KB chunk (192KB): 2 / 400 --
Comment-GroupTimeSize: Measured per chunk (how long does it take in milliseconds) and then devided. Should have a buffer of 200ms or more. If NumberOfTimeSignalingGroups is 1, then set this option to -1 (unused)
Comment-MinNumberOfThreadsPerProcesso: [Min 4 or 8 Threads seems to be ok for small number of cores, but I have tested with 16 on 8c/16threads cpu and it performed well.]
Comment-EnableExpiresHeader: [Whether to enable the HTTP Expire header (with a null) or not]
